text.p: These are the leading stories in the Egyptian press on Wedesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- President Hosni Mubarak says: Toshka represents a whole new civilisation which is built according to correct planning and the least expenditure and it is designed to benefit the people. Construction work in the project is going at a steady rate and the Oweinat road will be ready next month. Ninety percent of the problems sparked by the new land lease law are being solved and the remaining 10 percent will be solved by October. The Arab common market is the only solution because it transforms the Arabs from consumers to producers.
- Palestinian President Yasser Arafat to visit Cairo on Thursday to follow up the results of the Egyptian attempts to restart peace talks.
- Problems surround the government of Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin.
- Mubarak visits the Toshka site to see the new developments.
- Mubarak bids Oman's Sultan Qaboos farewell. Both leaders have identical points of view on the Middle East peace process.
- Mubarak says: We're not on anybody's payroll and we do not put any pressure on the Palestinians. Computer data cannot solve the peace problems in the region.
- Egypt to put on trial 47 terrorists.
- The United States is still giving aid to Egypt.
- Doctors operate on a "pregnant" 15-year-old boy to remove the fully-formed baby.
